metadata.title: The Classic Lit Club's Glorious Days of Yore

tracks.text: Students head home from school. Chitanda pushes a bike, and Hotaro walks next to her.
She stops
Hotaro turns around. A gust blows Chitanda's hair, then settles.
Hotaro blinks. Later, Mayaka and Satoshi look at Chitanda in the club room.
Chitanda smiles earnestly.
Hotaro waits at a crosswalk, straddling a bike. He checks his watch, then looks to the left.
The boys bike on. Shots of the city, nestled in a mountain valley. A stream runs between suburban houses. Hydrangeas bloom in a garden box by the street. The boys bike by.
They bike past a restaurant, around a corner, and through an intersection. Satoshi flips down to gear 5, and the mechanism in his bike adjusts. They pass a bridge and a children's playground.
He slows until he's side to side with Hotaro.
They bike past rice.
Satoshi smiles beneath a blue sky. Hotaro side eyes him. Plant guards, resembling long, white tubes cut in half, dot the land behind them.
They bike up hill, past rice paddies and wild flowers.
The boys approach the gate of a traditional japanese walled estate. Our view rises, to see the whole property. There are woods, gardens, ponds, out buildings, and a large, central house.
Satoshi mimes a butler bowing. Hotaro looks away and walks through the gate.
At the central house, Hotaro rings a door bell. Chitanda opens the door, smiling.
Satoshi pouts. Inside, the boys change into house slippers.

They walk along a bamboo floor, between paper sliding walls. Hotaro notices a a small low table with a circle in the center, an antique hibachi brazier, faded but well cared for. It sits in a room with traditional tatami mats.

Traditional wall scroll paintings of small songbirds fluttering around white chrysanthemums. Faded black hokkai food boxes covered in red cord. 3 naginata, swords on the ends of poles, are mounted over a door.
Mayaka sits on a cushion at a low table in a 20 tatami mat room. A tatami mat is about a twin sized mattress.
Satoshi removes his house slippers, and walks barefoot across the mats. He sits at the far end of the table. Hotaro joins Satoshi and Mayaka.
Senpai gave Hyouka its name.
Boushu, The Seeding, The time to sow bearded grains.
Traditional clay stoves and firewood sit dusty in a corner. The kids sit on the walkway with the exterior doors parted. They look at the pond and garden. Mayaka hands papers to the others.
Satoshi smiles. In the kitchen sits bowls of salt, water, and green, black, and red fillings. Chitanda users her hands to form rice into a triangle, and puts the onigiri on a plate.
Her hair is up in a ponytail, revealing the nape of her neck. Her yellow apron is tied into a bow in the back, which bounces slightly as she works.
Mayaka talks to Chitanda over Hotaro's shoulder. He looks away. Satoshi waves papers in front of him.
No violence occurred... nonviolent resistence
Hotaro frowns at the report, which becomes blurry.
Words flash by
Dark clouds roll in.
Rain speckles the pond.
He turns right, and sees a corner
He turns the other way, and sees a door ajar.
A room with a desk, bookbag, pillows shaped like orange slices, a tea kettle, and a girl's high school uniform with a blue ribbon.
Hotaro steps back, then notices the desk with old newspaper clippings, pictures from 1968, and postcards from Malaysia.
A bathroom with floral matts and potted plants.
Wind blows, clocks tick, and words fly past him, stirring a breeze through his hair. He pulls on his bangs.
The kids sit in the 20 tatami mat room.
She hands Hotaro a white umbrella, and nods after them as he and Satoshi leave.
Holding her hands, she slowly walks down the hallway.
She kneels down to pick up a wet leaf by the open door.
She stares outside at the rain.
